faqs.question: What critical legal documents must I verify before buying a plot here
faqs.answer: Essential documents include the Sale Deed ensuring clear ownership the Mutation document reflecting current official records the Release Certificate if the plot was previously mortgaged and the current Non-Encumbrance Certificate. Additionally the approved zoning plan and layout plan from the relevant municipal authority must be checked meticulously for compliance.

faqs.answer: FAR regulations vary depending on the plot size and the exact municipal jurisdiction applicable in Sector 19. Generally smaller plots have a higher permissible FAR compared to very large parcels but this is subject to revision by the DTCP or the municipal corporation.
